title: Sushi Rice
directions: Rinse the rice in cold water until the water runs mostly clear.
Add rice and water to a rice cooker and cook according to the rice cooker instructions.
While the rice cooks, mix together the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until dissolved.
When the rice is done, transfer to a large bowl (ideally a chilled bowl).
Pour the vinegar mixture over the hot rice.
Fold gently with a rice paddle - do not mash the rice.
Let cool to warm room temperature before using for sushi rolls. Do not refrigerate.
notes: Short-grain Japanese rice is strongly recommended over long-grain rice for sushi. It is the difference between a decent attempt and restaurant-quality sushi. The rice should be sticky enough to hold together but not mushy. Use a plastic or wooden rice paddle for folding.
